member.name: M:ProcessRunner.Process.ByPathAndArguments(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Run a process and return the exit code.
member.param: The path to the process to execute.
The command line arguments to the process.
member.returns: The exit code for the process.

member.name: M:ProcessRunner.Process.KillCurrentProcess(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Kill the current process and return the exit code. ATTENTION: Use carefully! If run in DynamoSandbox this node will kill the DynamoSandbox.exe process, if run in DynamoRevit it will kill the Revit.exe process!
member.param: Should the current process be terminted?
member.returns: The exit code for the process.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Automation.Journal.ByWorkspacePath(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Create a journal file for executing a Dynamo workspace on a Revit file.
This journal file uses several keys specifically for the purpose of automating Dynamo. Dynamo is never run in the idle loop. The workspace is executed immediately, and control is returned to the DynamoRevit external application.
member.param: The path to the Revit file. This can be an .rvt or .rfa file. The path may not contain whitespace or accented characters.
The path to the Dynamo workspace. The path may not contain whitespace or accented characters.
The path of the generated journal file.
The version number of Revit (e.g. 2017).
Should the journal file be run in debug mode? Set this to true if you expect models to have warnings (e.g. missing links etc.).
Should the model be switched to the default 3D view on open? Set this to true if you expect models will open with a perspective view as last saved view / starting view.
Should a (workshared) model be detached from central on open?
When detaching a (workshared) model from central, should worksets be discarded?
member.returns: The path of the generated journal file.
